0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Hemorrhoids: apply 1% AEROSOL FOAM TOPICALLY to external anorectal area OR one applicatorful RECTALLY 2-3 times daily
  • Hemorrhoids: apply 1% CREAM TOPICALLY to external anorectal area up to 5 times daily, after area has been cleansed and dried
  • Hemorrhoids: apply 1% OINTMENT RECTALLY OR TOPICALLY to anorectal area up to 5 times daily; in the morning, at night, and after bowel movements

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• for anorectal use only
  • pediatric, geriatric, acutely ill, or debilitated patients

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Pramoxine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    shake well before use
  • Topical
    dispense onto a clean tissue and apply to affected area

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    • Rectal Foam: 1 %
    • Topical Foam: 1 %
  • Curasore
    Topical Liquid: 1 %
  • Prax
    Topical Lotion: 1 %
  • Prax Wipes
    Topical Pad: 1 %
  • Proctofoam
    Topical Foam: 1 %
  • Sarna Sensitive
    Topical Lotion: 1 %
  • Tronolane
    Topical Cream: 1 %

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause contact dermatitis or eczema.
  • Advise patient to contact healthcare professional if symptoms get worse or do not improve within 7 days.
